itemDescription: A powerful crushing device that harnesses rocket technology to increase smashing force.
itemLore: Where there is intelligence, there is progress. So long as there is progress, the old must always make way for the new.

lockedModInfo.modDescription: Charge Melee Attacks increase the speed of all Melee Attacks by 10% for 5s.

itemDescription: A long, sharp blade hammered out of vehicle leaf springs. Well-rounded for most situations.
itemLore: Something familiar about this blade... It's seen a lot, and done even more. This is where it all begins, and where it all ends--at the end of a sword.

itemDescription: A short, but thick sword, used by Gul Warriors. It's compact design makes for swift yet hard-hitting blows. An excellent close-range option.
itemLore: Most of the nobility forbid the Gul from carrying weapons, but much like the Ahanae prohibition on common crystal usage, that decree has been surreptitiously ignored.

itemDescription: A razor-sharp hand axe. Excellent for separating flesh from bone. Charge for double attacks.
itemLore: My folk have always been industrious and hard-working, using what was around them and shaping it to their liking--not in the manipulative, magical way of these Fae, but with the straightforward, visceral processes of nature herself

itemDescription: Makeshift claws fashioned from decayed root and rusted metal.
itemLore: The cores, both old and new, struggled against the corruption in similar ways and with similar probabilities of success. A detailed investigation reveals that the differences between the two were negligible. Earths success against the corruption was simply a matter of probability.

itemDescription: An elegant, yet light blade, designed to bring beauty to bloodshed. Unstoppable in the hands of a master swordsman.
itemLore: Though Linedhel is best known for breaking the siege of Elenran, she went on to become one of the Pan's deadliest and most feared swordsmen.

itemDescription: A giant broadsword made from flattened railroad tracks. Dozens of ridges cut in the side for causing irreparable damage.
itemLore: I may be a bit too old to wield this sword, but if I were still in my prime, I might have given it a go. Hell, the sheer size and weight of the thing could make even the Root tremble in fear. Ah, but those days are long gone for me.

itemDescription: Steel knuckles with rusty sawblade tips, designed to boost Unarmed damage.
itemLore: Going toe-to-toe with the Root in hand-to-hand combat is either a sign of immense bravery or utter foolishness.

itemDescription: Basic Strikes generate 10% additional Mod Power. Charge Attacks perform an AOE which strikes all enemies within 2m, dealing 75 Damage. AOE Damage generates 50% additional Mod Power.
itemLore: It is against my purpose to grow attached to the worlds' children. I oversee all, but seldom interfere. So long as a single intelligent lifeform remains, so too does its world. But the entity must endure its life on its own.

itemDescription: An intricately-forged elongated sword. Designed to keep stronger enemies at bay, while remaining light enough for agile maneuvers.
itemLore: The forsaken prince's past has only hardened his personality--like tempered steel. His father, imperious and immortal. His mother, strong yet bitter. It isa miracle he survived to adulthood at all...and that he has not slaughtered more along the way.

itemDescription: An intricately-forged mace with uniquely designed airways. Allows smaller wielders to get the mace up to speed much quicker.
itemLore: The Fae, perhaps more than most, revere the utility of death. Bloodshed has always proven an expedient solution to problems otherwise too troublesome to solve.

itemDescription: A spear perfect for staying at a distance. Has excellent range, great recovery, and focused direct damage for one on one combat.
itemLore: It was Navun who first spread the word of the Thaen's death. Few believed her except for the slaves, whose entire subservience assumed the immortality of their masters. Navun thus birthed and nurtured the rebellion that now tears at our walls. She is mother, warrior, and terrorist all.

itemDescription: Standard issue Greatsword for the Empress's Royal Guards. Razor-sharp edges, extremely heavy, yet perfectly balanced.
itemLore: Kolket was the greatest of the Pan monarchs and the last in a long, grand dynasty. The royal Pan lineage once stretched back for an epoch--perhaps further back than even Yaesha itself, though none can truly know.

itemDescription: A pair of old-canine training bracers converted into deadly claws. Used for slashing and ripping.
itemLore: These claw weapons certainly give off a menacing vibe, like some sort of monster. Then again, in a world where you have to fight tooth and nail to survive, sometimes it takes a monster to fight a monster.

itemDescription: A large, heavy warhammer cobbled together from engine components. It is a slow- but-devastating weapon meant to destroy anything it hits.
itemLore: The world was growing faster than ever before when the Root arrived. With buildings towering into the clouds, tools once used for construction now serve as weapons to fight for its survival.

itemDescription: A common chopping tool that has been repurposed for combat. Rapidly cycles attacks from right to left. Charge attacks strike twice.
itemLore: If you're unable to be inventive, your survival prospects are grim at best. It's time to put that eccentric notion you've been saving into action.

itemDescription: A staff made from old plumbing parts used for controlling wide swaths in front of the wielder.
itemLore: Despite its appearance, I must say I'm impressed with the design of this weapon. It just goes to show that it's not about how pretty or shiny a weapon is, but rather if it can get thejob done.

itemDescription: An unorthodox weapon meant to convert momentum into destruction. Some attacks can continuously chain overhead swings.
itemLore: If you can swing it and it kills some Root in the process, then it's a damn fine weapon. When it comes down to it, survival is the only metric that matters.

itemDescription: An old piece of steel with serrations cut into one side. Pipe handle provides limited grip.
itemLore: History within the two Cores followed a similar path. At a macro level in fact, one might notice no difference at all. The contrast becomes apparent, however, when one investigates history at an individual level.

itemDescription: A spear perfect for staying at range with quick, focused attacks. High, single-target damage.
itemLore: Back in my younger days, I'l bet | could've wielded this like a pro. But now, my old bones just can't keep up. Still, can't help but be impressed by those who can handle such a dangerous and powerful weapon without injuring themselves.

itemDescription: A long, sharp blade hammered out of vehicle leaf springs. Well-rounded for most situations.
itemLore: Gone are the days when rust was merely a bothersome corrosion. In our current landscape, it serves as a calculated advantage. A wound inflicted with rust-laden weaponry poses a significantly greater challenge to remedy.

itemDescription: Dealing damage unleashes the dormant Toxic Gas within the head. When infused, Basic Attacks apply CORRODED for 5s.
itemLore: The ambit ember, though critical for the navigation of N'Erud as well as my own personal survival, can be poisonous to lifeforms of lesser intellect. This might have mattered more had we discovered any such lifeforms.

lockedModInfo.modDescription: When infused, Neural Backdash Charge Attack explodes in a 3m. AOE and leaves an ACID Cloud which last for 15s.

itemDescription: A N'Erudian tool converted into a ruthless ripping device. High raw damage.
itemLore: It is a blessing that in all our millennia of travel, the Ofildi never once rebelled--not because they feared the Phetyr, for the Ofildi outnumbered the Phetyr ten to one and had access to potent weapons of their own, but because the Ofildi were unified in purpose with all Drzyr.

itemDescription: The spear is oddly...quiet. Even when you slide your hand across its haft or drop it upon the ground, it makes an unthinkably small amount of noise.
itemLore: They say the Huntress is a direct descendant of Aramin and Aramor, the brothers who once slayed their god so that they might lay claim to the birthright of their own creation. She certainly lives up to the tale.

lockedModInfo.modDescription: Charge attacks use 25 stamina to throw the spear which returns to the wielder's hand.

itemDescription: Infused with Krell Shock magic, can be thrown if the wielder has stamina. Axe will magically reappear in-hand. Charge to throw.
itemLore: Some Pan consider the Krell to be comical in appearance, yet these paxultek wielded great skill in combat. It is said they faced many enemies on their own world--even a towering cyclops and the Destroyer himself.

lockedModInfo.modDescription: Charge to throw the Krell Axe which applies OVERLOADED on hit, dealing 50 SHOCK Damage every 5s for 10s. Shortly after throwing, another will appear in the wielders hand.Costs 25 Stamina.

itemDescription: Lightweight. Silent. Deadly. It's rumored that the blade is meant to bestow a slow, agonizing death.
itemLore: Despite what people might say, laws are not made to be broken. They can, however, be interpreted, elided, even wilfully misunderstood. Any law can be circumvented in the right circumstances--even the laws of the One True King.

lockedModInfo.modDescription: Damage increases by +25% against BLEEDING enemies, and +25% when attacking from behind. Charge Attacks deal 200 BLEEDING damage over 10s.

itemDescription: A giant tool for splitting heavy rocks.
itemLore: Molecules to atoms, atoms to protons, protons to quarks--down and down into the fundamental quanticles of the universe. The deeper one goes, the more one understands how much one does not understand.

lockedModInfo.modDescription: On Neutral Evade Attacks Atom Splitter achieves Nuclear Fission, releasing a wave of charged particles which deals 150 Damage to targets within 20m.Charged Neutral Evade Attacks increase Range by 3x and Damage by 25%.

itemDescription: There is an ethereal lightness to this weapon, as though it were made of paper or breath.Though it strikes its foes forcibly enough.
itemLore: Some believe dreams to be prophecy. Others, a random narrative woven by misfiring synapses. Yet dreams are nothing more than the true essence of the self, the soul untethered-- entirely inscrutable yet imperative to possess.

lockedModInfo.modDescription: After dealing 250 damage, Charge Attack will release a Dreamwave, flowing outwards 20m and returning to caster.Dreamwave applies SLOW to all enemies for 10s and grants a Stack of REVERIE for each enemy affected. Each Stack grants +2% to All Damage and +2% Movement Speed, which lasts 15s.

itemDescription: A pair of gauntlets with sharp crystal blades that strike with vicious speed and velocity.
itemLore: When the Pan first arrived in Yaesha, the Vaunnt hid their vision of the Wolf--a portent of looming doom--and shared only the vision of the blessed Doe. Would the Pan have remained on these shores had they known?

lockedModInfo.modDescription: Dealing Melee Damage 6 times over 10s empowers Feral Judgement. When empowered, Neutral Backdash Charge attacks apply Death Sentence.After 1.5s of being sentenced, the enemy will suffer 10 Phantom Strikes, dealing 25 Damage each. Deals 25% additional damage to BLEEDING enemies.

itemDescription: An expertly balanced blade that is the produc of advanced Fae metallurgy.
itemLore: There is an ineluctable truth throughout all known creation: nothing is ever truly gained nor truly lost.Energy transfers from one object to the next. One life lost ends up as fuel for another. And when two worlds twine, the will of one is sundered in twain.This is the inevitability of the universe.

lockedModInfo.modDescription: Charge Attacks taint the blood of targets, causing all attacks from Godsplitter to register as Weakspot hits for 2s seconds.

itemDescription: An ancient, quick, and versatile blade suited for many situations. Charge attacks cast a projectile for dealing melee damage at range.
itemLore: l remember the day when the Wanderer departed, leaving behind their loyal companion, this sword. The very same blade that had fought alongside them in countless battles, now lay on the ground of Ward 13, a testament to the hero's journey. Though the Wanderer moved on, the sword remained, a silent sentinel waiting for its next worthy wielder to take up its cause.

lockedModInfo.modDescription: Charge attacks use 35 stamina to release an energy wave projectile allowing the wielder to strike enemies from much farther away.

itemDescription: Fast striking claws with a high Critical Hit Chance.Neutral Dodge grants the power  of Lifesteal.
itemLore: Was it these twined kingdoms that drove her to prey upon the fearful? Did the unholy twisting of our worlds drive her mad as it did so many others? Or does she revel in a freedom she has always desired, now that her king and tyrant sleeps? I fear I have always known the answer.

lockedModInfo.modDescription: Neutral Evade turns to mist, granting Nightshade 5% base damage as Lifesteal for 5s. Perfect Dodge doubles duration.

itemDescription: A magical stave rumored to contain a healing spirit within. Strikes with wide swings.
itemLore: The Doe first appeared to the Vaunnt as a blessed portent, a sign that the Pan's long journey had come to an end. But the Doe also symbolizes compassion and sacrifice, and so the vision that at first was taken to mean rest was later interpreted as a call to protect.

lockedModInfo.modDescription: After dealing 250 damage, the next charge attack causes the spirit of the RED DOE to stampede forward, dealing 160 damage to enemies and regenerating 10% Health to allies in its path.

itemDescription: A super-heated laser sword with an infinitely sharp edge. Perfect for cutting... anything.
itemLore: The Drzyr did not die in Alepsis-Taura, though in what form they now exist, I cannot say, Nothing is lost in the universe. It is merely repurposed. It is unlikely, however, that their repurposing retains the former miracle of consciousness.

lockedModInfo.modDescription: Neutral Backdash Charge creates a Whirlwind of slashes which strike all enemies within 8m for 75 damage.

itemDescription: A massive Greatsword which contains the harnessed magic of a corrupted Guardian. Can summon small shockwaves.
itemLore: The Pan are doomed without the One of Many to protect them. And yet, the Pan have been doomed many times over in our history. Still, we remain. The Balance will not result in our end--not yet.

lockedModInfo.modDescription: Charge to fire off ground-based shockwaves which deals 115 damage. Costs 35 Stamina.

itemDescription: Dealing damage unleashes the dormant Toxic Gas within the head. When infused, Basic Attacks apply CORRODED for 5s.
itemLore: The ambit ember, though critical for the navigation of N'Erud as well as my own personal survival, can be poisonous to lifeforms of lesser intellect. This might have mattered more had we discovered any such lifeforms.

lockedModInfo.modDescription: When infused, Neural Backdash Charge Attack explodes in a 3m. AOE and leaves an ACID Cloud which last for 15s.

itemDescription: Ascorched blade imbued with FIRE.
itemLore: The idea of defeating the Root Dragon was something I couldn't even fathom, let alone fashioning a weapon from its remains. The sheer willpower and tenacity of the Wanderer was truly remarkable.

lockedModInfo.modDescription: Charge Melee Attacks apply BURNING which deals 150 FIRE damage over 5s

itemDescription: A glowing Greatsword forged from shards of a shattered Worldstone. Chargeattacks cast waves.
itemLore: Harsgaard had us all fooled, played us like a fiddle. Who could have guessed that he was in cahoots with the Root? And yet, despite all odds, he managed to survive all these years... though I wouldn't exactly call it 'surviving'. "

lockedModInfo.modDescription: Charge Attacks release a wide horizontal projectile that penetrates through multiple enemies dealing 116 damage.
